title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island today
byline: The Department of Meteorology said that showers or thundershowers will occur at several places in Eastern, Uva, Central, provinces and in Polonnaruwa and Hambantota districts after 1.00 p.m.

title: “Our children possess the strength to build the nation” – PM Harini
byline: Minister of Education, Higher Education, and Vocational Education, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that children of this country possess the strength, ability, and attitude required to build the nation, and it is the responsibility of adults to open the paths for them to move forward.

title: Trump threatens to impose additional 100% tariff on China
byline: US President Donald Trump has said he would impose an additional 100% tariff on imports from China from next month.

title: Macron reappoints Lecornu as French PM after days of turmoil
byline: President Emmanuel Macron has asked Sébastien Lecornu to return as French prime minister only four days after he stood down from the post, sparking a week of high drama and political turmoil.

title: India upgrades ties with Afghanistan’s Taliban, says it will reopen Kabul embassy
byline: India on Friday upgraded ties with Afghanistan’s Taliban administration, giving a boost to the diplomatically isolated group, by announcing it would reopen its embassy in Kabul that was shut after the Taliban seized power in 2021.

title: PUCSL to announce final decision on electricity tariff revision on Oct 14
byline: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) announced that its final decision on the proposed revision of electricity tariffs will be made public on October 14.

title: Blast at Tennessee munitions plant leaves 19 missing, possibly dead
byline: Nineteen people were missing and possibly dead after a devastating explosion on Friday morning at a military explosives plant in Tennessee, officials said.

title: 30 Indian fishermen remanded for poaching off Delft Island
byline: Thirty Indian fishermen have been remanded for allegedly engaging in illegal fishing activities near Delft Island in Jaffna.

title: Nearly 60% of school students in Sri Lanka suffer from stress: Study
byline: It has been revealed that nearly 60 percent of school students in Sri Lanka are experiencing stress symptoms to different extents, according to recent research findings.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in several provinces and districts.

title: Nobel Peace Prize winner Machado dedicates award to Trump
byline: Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado dedicated her Nobel Peace Prize on Friday (Oct 10) to the people of Venezuela - and US President Donald Trump, for his “decisive support” for her country’s pro-democracy movement.

title: President promotes 5 Brigadiers to rank of Major General
byline: In conjunction with the 76th Anniversary of the Sri Lanka Army, five Brigadiers have been promoted to the rank of Major General.

title: Egg prices to drop by Rs. 10
byline: The All Ceylon Egg Producers Association has announced a reduction in egg prices by Rs. 10 in the local market.

title: Drug trafficker sentenced to life in prison for heroin possession
byline: The Colombo High Court, which sentenced alleged drug trafficker Kanapathi Ganesh alias Thotalaga Kanna to life imprisonment for the possession ...

title: Gold prices in Sri Lanka surge by around Rs. 5,000 today
byline: Gold prices in Sri Lanka have been increased by approximately Rs. 5,000 today (11) in comparison to the last week.

title: COPE reveals irregular confirmation of 850 Sathosa employees ahead of 2024 elections
byline: The Committee on Public Enterprises (COPE) has revealed that 850 employees of Lanka Sathosa were confirmed in service through irregular procedures prior to last year’s elections.

title: 15 new breast cancer cases reported daily in Sri Lanka
byline: Approximately 15 new breast cancer cases are reported daily in Sri Lanka, while about three women die each day due to the disease, health authorities have revealed.

title: Attorney-at-Law disenrolled for violating professional ethics
byline: The Supreme Court has ordered the disenrollment of an Attorney-at-Law from Kandy, who was convicted of violating the professional ethics of the legal profession.

title: Guatemala receives first flight from US with third-country migrants
byline: Guatemala’s IGM migration authority said late on Friday it had received a first flight from the U.S. carrying foreign migrants returned from the United States, as well as Guatemalan citizens.

title: Tourist arrivals in first 9 days of October tops 46,000
byline: The number of tourist arrivals to Sri Lanka has reached 46,868 during the first nine days of October.

title: Reappointed French PM scrambles to form government
byline: Pressure mounted on Saturday (Oct 11) on France’s newly reappointed premier Sebastien Lecornu to get an austerity budget approved, as more parties threatened to topple a man whose first term lasted a mere 27 days.

title: Aid groups seize on truce to tackle Gaza hunger
byline: International agencies were preparing on Saturday (Oct 11) to pour aid into Gaza, hopeful that a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas will allow them to put an end to the famine haunting parts of the territory.

title: Shooting incident reported in Kalutara
byline: Two individuals on a motorcycle have reportedly opened fire at a shop in Palathota, Kalutara this evening (11).

title: President assures investments in Sri Lanka are secure under the current govt
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake emphasized that the security of investors and investments coming into the country has been ensured under the current government.

title: Stock of live ammunition discovered near a canal in Mathugama
byline: A stock of live ammunition has been discovered near a canal in the Nagahawala area of Sirikadura, Mathugama.

title: PM departs for China to attend Global Leaders’ Meeting on Women
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya departs for China tonight (11 October) to attend the Global Leaders’ Meeting on Women 2025, upon the invitation of the Government of the People’s Republic of China, the PM’s Office said.
